ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Definitely take it!! The workload is manageable and Professor Stern is just really good.
If you're interested in Jewish thought - yes!!! Otherwise this would be a little bit repetitive.
Take it. Stern is an awesome lecturer and you learn a lot about Jewish history.

Probably a hard class to keep up with if you're not Jewish or a religious studies major. It was an interesting course and taught me a lot about Jewish intellectual history, but definitely a course I'd only recommend to people with a specific interest in Jewish history and culture in the modern period.

I strongly recommend this class. Prof. Stern's lectures are engaging and delivered in a semi-seminar format. I learned a ton in this class and gained a new perspective on both Jewish intellectual history and Western thought in general. I left everyday with something to think about. The workload is also pretty manageable! Definitely take this class!
If you are genuinely interested in Jewish history/philosophy this is a must take. I highly recommend the class.

Learn an intro to modern Jewish thought from an enjoyable knowledgeable and VERY reasonable professor. Overview of major thinkers and waves of thought/historical developments. Opportunities to explore more niche things that interest you in writing two papers.
